# Code of Conduct – Message from the CEO 

As one of the world’s largest financial services institutions,

query: Wells Fargo business conduct and customer service standards.
original_chunk:
the work we do at Wells Fargo brings real responsibility. It requires that we act with the highest standards of trust and integrity. 

Each day we make decisions in how to conduct our business and serve our customers and communities.

query: What guides employee behavior at Wells Fargo?
original_chunk: Each day we make decisions in how to conduct our business and serve our customers and communities. This Code of Conduct, together with our Employee Handbook and other company policies, guides us in how to do the right thing in the right way.

query: Accountability for employee actions and decisions.
original_chunk: Wells Fargo does not tolerate unethical behavior. We are all responsible for our actions and the decisions we make, and we must hold each other accountable for the outcomes of those actions and decisions.

query: CEO thanking employees for commitment to Code of Conduct
original_chunk:
Thank you for your commitment to our Code of Conduct, and thank you for the work you do to support our success. 

Charles W. Scharf 

CEO,

query: Wells Fargo CEO Code of Conduct requirements
original_chunk:
Charles W. Scharf 

CEO, Wells Fargo & Company Our Code 

Our Code of Conduct (Code) applies to all employees, including executive officers,

query: Wells Fargo Board of Directors definition
original_chunk: including executive officers, and in some cases the Board of Directors of Wells Fargo & Company (collectively referred to in this document as “the Board”).

query: Compliance with company policies and applicable laws.
original_chunk: Employees are expected to adhere to the Code, Employee Handbook, and company policies and to comply with applicable laws and regulations.

query: What happens if company policies conflict with local laws?
original_chunk:
Wells Fargo operates globally, and if, at any time, the Code 1 or our policies differ with local laws and regulations, the more restrictive guidance applies. 

Whenever an expectation is unclear, employees should speak with their manager.

query: What to do when an expectation is unclear at work.
original_chunk: Whenever an expectation is unclear, employees should speak with their manager. If employees are uncomfortable speaking with their manager they can contact Employee Relations (ER), or the Ethics Office.

query: Third party vendors integrity standards compliance requirements
original_chunk: Wells Fargo seeks to engage third parties and contingent resources that share our commitment to honesty and integrity, and act in a manner consistent with the Code.

query: What are my responsibilities under the Employee Code of Conduct?
original_chunk:
# Accountability 

All employees and the Board have a role in maintaining the trust of our customers and stakeholders and complying with applicable laws and regulations. Employees are expected to: 

• Abide by the Code and seek guidance when uncertain.

query: What are Wells Fargo's employee code of conduct expectations?
original_chunk:
Employees are expected to: 

• Abide by the Code and seek guidance when uncertain. 

• Comply with company policies. 

• Represent Wells Fargo accurately and professionally. 

• Manage risk in alignment with the company’s Risk Management Framework.

query: Leaders risk management responsibility
original_chunk:
• Manage risk in alignment with the company’s Risk Management Framework. 

As leaders, managers have an even greater level of responsibility.

query: Managers' responsibilities in leading with integrity.
original_chunk:
As leaders, managers have an even greater level of responsibility. In addition to their responsibilities as employees, managers are expected to: 

• Lead with integrity, demonstrating and reinforcing the Code.

query: What is Wells Fargo's policy on speaking up without retaliation?
original_chunk:
• Help employees understand the importance of following the Code and policies. 

• Hold their employees accountable for adhering to the Code and policies. 

• Foster a work environment where employees feel comfortable speaking up without fear of retaliation.

query: Reporting misconduct anonymously without fear of retaliation.
original_chunk:
• Foster a work environment where employees feel comfortable speaking up without fear of retaliation. 

• Listen to employees and report concerns that may be misconduct as soon as possible, with appropriate confidentiality. 

• Develop high performing teams.

query: What language versions of the Code of Conduct exist?
original_chunk:
• Develop high performing teams.

# Who we are 

Wells Fargo is committed to a culture that attracts and retains the best people who help us become a better, stronger company.

query: Risk Management Framework company culture components
original_chunk: a culture that attracts and retains the best people who help us become a better, stronger company. Adherence to the Risk Management Framework and effective risk management are key components of our company’s culture.

query: What drives our customer-centric company culture?
original_chunk: Our culture is also guided by a customer-centric focus informed by employee engagement and feedback and reinforced by clear employee expectations.

query: What are Wells Fargo's employee expectations?
original_chunk: Our employee expectations are designed to be clear and straightforward, to drive the highest standards of integrity and operational excellence, and to provide guidance for doing what’s right and doing it well.

• Embrace candor

# Diversity, equity, and inclusion 

We are committed to creating a culture with broad representation of who we are, how we think, and how we make decisions.

query: Increasing diverse representation in the company culture.
original_chunk: how we think, and how we make decisions. We are focused on increasing diverse representation at all levels of the company through an inclusive culture and workplace environment; better serving and growing relationships with diverse customers in each line of business; and supporting our spend with diverse suppliers company-wide.

query: Wells Fargo expectations for diversity and inclusion.
original_chunk: One of our expectations is to champion diversity, equity, and inclusion.

query: Benefits of a diverse workforce at Wells Fargo.
original_chunk: One of our expectations is to champion diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe a diverse and inclusive workforce drives creativity, insight, and innovation in our business, and allows us to respond effectively to the evolving needs of our customers, colleagues, and communities.

query: Creating a safe and inclusive workplace environment.

• Solicit diverse ideas that challenge thinking.

query: Reporting misconduct in the Code of Conduct
original_chunk:
Code of Conduct

# Speaking up 

Employees are responsible for speaking up promptly when becoming aware of potential misconduct, including potential violations of the Code, even if the employee is not directly involved or affected by the behavior.

query: Investigating allegations of misconduct in the workplace.
original_chunk: even if the employee is not directly involved or affected by the behavior. Allegations of misconduct are investigated and managed in an objective, thorough, consistent, and timely manner with the goal of understanding and resolving concerns.

query: Reporting potential misconduct to manager or other channels

query: Reporting non misconduct concerns at work

# Reporting concerns that are not misconduct 

Concerns unrelated to misconduct such as performance feedback, workplace disputes, inadvertent errors, business processes, or not following procedures should also be raised.

query: Reporting channels for workplace disputes and performance concerns.
original_chunk:

query: Reporting channels for workplace disputes at Wells Fargo.

• Employee Relations for performance concerns or workplace disputes.

# Nonretaliation commitment 

Wells Fargo prohibits retaliation against any employee who reports misconduct or speaks up in

query: Reporting misconduct without retaliation policy
original_chunk:
commitment 

Wells Fargo prohibits retaliation against any employee who reports misconduct or speaks up in good faith about potential violations of company policies, procedures, this Code, or potential noncompliance with law.

query: Retaliation against employees who report policy violations.
original_chunk: potential violations of company policies, procedures, this Code, or potential noncompliance with law. Similarly, Wells Fargo prohibits retaliation against any employee who assists or participates in an investigation, proceeding, or hearing, or exercises any right protected by law.

query: Reporting financial reporting code violations
original_chunk:
Employees must report potential retaliation using methods listed under Resources to report potential misconduct. 

# Accounting, internal controls, or auditing matters 

If an employee becomes aware of Code violations related to Wells Fargo’s financial reporting, accounting, internal controls,

query: Reporting internal control or audit violations to whom
original_chunk: accounting, internal controls, or audit matters, then they must report such violations using a reporting channel listed under Resources to report potential misconduct or directly to the Audit Committee of the Board.

query: Communicating with Board directors or committees process
original_chunk: Information about communicating with directors or other committees of the Board and the process for reviewing communications sent to the Board or its members is available on the Leadership and Governance page of wellsfargo.com .

query: What to do in case of workplace violence threat
original_chunk:
# Safety concerns 

Acts of violence, threats or perceived threats should be taken seriously. In the event of immediate danger, employees should contact local law enforcement at 911 or other designated emergency number.

query: Report non-emergency security threats to Wells Fargo.

Non-emergency threats can be reported to the Wells Fargo Security Response Center at U.S. (877) 494-9355, non-U.S. call 

001‑480‑437‑7599 , or to a manager.

breach of trust, money laundering, or the manufacture, sale, distribution, or trafficking of controlled substances so that Wells Fargo can assess whether the offense impacts the employee’s employment eligibility.

# Upholding our ethical and legal obligations 

# Identify and avoid conflicts of interest 

Wells Fargo is

query: conflicts of interest in Wells Fargo policies
original_chunk:
Upholding our ethical and legal obligations 

# Identify and avoid conflicts of interest 

Wells Fargo is committed to identifying and either preventing or managing conflicts of interest.

query: Conflict of interest company reputation jeopardy
original_chunk:
of interest 

Wells Fargo is committed to identifying and either preventing or managing conflicts of interest. Employees need to recognize that certain activities can cause an actual, potential, or perceived conflict of interest, or jeopardize the company’s integrity or reputation.

query: Managing conflicts of interest in the workplace.
original_chunk:
Employees are expected to be transparent and to: 

• Identify and avoid conflicts where possible. 

• Pre-clear or disclose conflicts when required. 

• Mitigate or manage conflicts when necessary.

query: What are employee conflict of interest disclosure requirements?
original_chunk:
• Pre-clear or disclose conflicts when required. 

• Mitigate or manage conflicts when necessary. 

• Conduct personal activities away from work, outside of scheduled work time, and at their own expense.

query: pre-clearance of personal activities under company policies
original_chunk: Some employees are subject to additional requirements and restrictions, including pre-clearance of personal activities under company business policies and procedures.

query: pre-clearing employee activities with potential conflicts
original_chunk:
# Manage, mitigate, disclose, or pre -

# clear conflicts 

Employees need to pre-clear any activity that may give rise to a conflict prior to engaging in the activity. In addition, certain relationships and activities require disclosure to mitigate risk.

query: Compliance instructions for mitigating conflict of interest
original_chunk: In addition, certain relationships and activities require disclosure to mitigate risk. Once the pre-clearance or disclosure is processed, Compliance provides specific instructions on how to mitigate or manage any potential conflict of interest.

query: Conflict of interest definition Wells Fargo employees
original_chunk:
Definitions 

A personal conflict of interest occurs when an employee acts, or appears to act, in their personal interest rather than acting in the interest of Wells Fargo or its customers.

query: Using company property for personal benefit
original_chunk:
Examples of personal conflicts: 

• An employee receives an improper benefit or gift because of their position with Wells Fargo. 

• An employee uses company property, information, or position for personal benefit or to compete or divert business from Wells Fargo.

query: Conflict of interest in advisory services and financing transactions.
original_chunk:
A business conflict of interest occurs when Wells Fargo’s interests conflict with those of a customer. 

Examples of business conflicts: 

• Providing advisory services to a customer on a transaction while providing financing to another customer on the same transaction.

query: acting as trustee to debt security investors
original_chunk:
• Acting as trustee to investors on a debt security and acting as a lender to the security issuer.

# Examples of potential conflicts 

Below are some common situations where conflicts of interest may be present and how employees are expected to avoid the conflict of interest by not engaging in prohibited activities

query: What situations require pre-clearance to avoid conflict of interest?
original_chunk: may be present and how employees are expected to avoid the conflict of interest by not engaging in prohibited activities or obtaining pre-clearance when required. The list of situations is not meant to be a complete list of every place a conflict can occur.

query: Competing business owned by Wells Fargo employees.
original_chunk:
Outside activities 

Employees generally may not: 

• Own or operate a business that competes with Wells Fargo.

query: Wells Fargo conflict of interest secondary employment rules
original_chunk: • Accept secondary employment or perform consulting services with any entity that competes with Wells Fargo, otherwise conflicts with their Wells Fargo duties, or diverts Wells Fargo business.

query: Salesperson conflict of interest own residence purchase
original_chunk: • Act as a real estate salesperson, broker, or agent, except for the purchase or sale of their own residence.

query: director positions without pre clearance
original_chunk:
• Accept a position with any for-profit business as a director, trustee, officer, general partner, or similar position of influence without pre-clearance. 

• Be compensated directly or indirectly for providing investment or legal advice.

query: Conflict of interest in employee financial advice
original_chunk:
• Be compensated directly or indirectly for providing investment or legal advice. 

• Engage in activities related to the preparation, audit, or certification of statements or documents that Wells Fargo may rely on to make lending or other decisions related to any person or entity other than the employee.

query: Wells Fargo volunteer and charitable activities policy
original_chunk:
• Speak on the company’s behalf in the media without prior approval or publish works related to their role or the company without prior approval. 

Volunteer and charitable activities 

Wells Fargo encourages employees to be active volunteers in the community.

Volunteer and charitable activities 

Wells Fargo encourages employees to be active volunteers in the community. While many volunteer activities do not require pre-clearance, to avoid actual, potential, or perceived conflicts,

to avoid actual, potential, or perceived conflicts, employees must review pre-clearance requirements and when required obtain approval prior to engaging in certain nonprofit activities, including:

query: Wells Fargo employee financial product influence policy.

including: 

• Managing the finances or investments of the nonprofit. 

• Selecting or influencing selection of financial products or services. 

• Participating on the Board of an organization that is a Wells Fargo customer for more than deposit services.

query: Soliciting funds from customers or employees for a nonprofit.
original_chunk:
• Receiving compensation for service. 

Employees may not solicit Wells Fargo customers, employees, or third-party service providers when raising funds for a nonprofit.

Personal r elationships 

Personal relationships in the workplace may interfere with job responsibilities and decision making. For this reason, all employees, new hires,

Gifts and entertainment 

Wells Fargo permits giving and receiving business gifts and entertainment provided there is no reasonable inference that the gift or entertainment could influence the performance or decision making of any employee.

query: Gifts and entertainment with business associates guidelines
original_chunk: The gift or entertainment with any one individual or entity should occur infrequently and be consistent with accepted, lawful business practices and customs.

query: Gifts for business referrals or advantages

Employees should conduct themselves in accordance with the following expectations: 

• Refrain from giving and receiving gifts offered in exchange for business referrals or other business advantages.

query: Gifts that are not allowed by Wells Fargo policy
original_chunk: • Never give or receive gifts that are cash or cash equivalents, cannabis-related, or otherwise do not comply with our policies.

query: preclearing gifts with government officials globally

Gifts or entertainment provided to government officials or government entities are controlled by strict laws and regulations.

government officials or entities for the purpose of soliciting new government business.

query: Wells Fargo campaign contribution policy Political Action Committees
original_chunk: Company funds are never used for any campaign contributions, candidate campaign committees, political parties, caucuses, or independent expenditure committees. Wells Fargo supports U.S. candidates seeking public office only through Wells Fargo-sponsored Political Action Committees.

candidates seeking public office only through Wells Fargo-sponsored Political Action Committees.

Competition and antitrust laws

query: Compliance with antitrust laws in our operating jurisdictions.

Competition and antitrust laws 

Free and fair competition benefits Wells Fargo and its customers. Wells Fargo is committed to protecting free and fair competition by complying with applicable antitrust and competition laws in the jurisdictions in which we operate.

query: antitrust laws employee behavior restrictions
original_chunk:
To comply with antitrust and competition laws, employees must not engage in anticompetitive behavior including: 

• Agreeing with competitors to price fix, rig bids, allocate customers or territories, or restrict supply.

query: Anti competitive business practices with competitors
original_chunk:
• Exchanging non-public, sensitive information with competitors outside of approved collaborations or activities. 

• Colluding with competitors to boycott certain customers, suppliers, or other third parties. 

• Abusing a position of market dominance.

query: Anti-competitive agreements with other companies.
original_chunk:
• Abusing a position of market dominance. 

• Agreeing with another company not to hire or solicit each other’s employees or to restrict the terms of employee compensation.

query: Escalating anticompetitive discussions with customers.
original_chunk: If a competitor, customer, or third-party attempts to engage an employee in an anticompetitive discussion, that employee must stop the discussion and promptly escalate the matter according to the Anticompetitive Behavior Policy.

At Wells Fargo, we strive to provide advancement opportunities for our employees.

query: Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity policies.

Wells Fargo is dedicated to maintaining a safe work environment. 

All employees are required to perform their job duties unimpaired by illegal drugs, alcohol, or by the improper use of legal substances.

query: violence in the workplace policy

# Waivers and exceptions 

Any waivers or exceptions to the Code for executive officers or the Board may only be made by the Board or designated Board committee and will be promptly disclosed to our shareholders in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements.

query: What are consequences for violating employee code of conduct?

Any violation of the provisions of the Code or the referenced policies and guidelines is grounds for corrective action, which may include termination of employment.
